title: How to Make a Faucet Shine Like New

steps.headline: Wipe   Wipe away any loose dirt, toothpaste, food particles, etc, with a rag or wet paper towel.
Scrub   Scrub off any stuck on gook with a cleaning toothbrush, sponge, or rag.
steps.description: Use vinegar or baking soda mixed with water for a natural cleaner, or use store bought cleaners.

steps.headline: Clean.
steps.description: Wipe off all the grime you just scrubbed off. Clean out your scrubber and get most of it, then use a clean paper towel to get the rest.

steps.headline: Polish   Wet the faucet with a quick splash of water, then take a dry paper towel and wipe until dry and spotless.

text: Wipe   Wipe away any loose dirt, toothpaste, food particles, etc, with a rag or wet paper towel.  Scrub   Scrub off any stuck on gook with a cleaning toothbrush, sponge, or rag. Use vinegar or baking soda mixed with water for a natural cleaner, or use store bought cleaners. Clean. Wipe off all the grime you just scrubbed off. Clean out your scrubber and get most of it, then use a clean paper towel to get the rest. Polish   Wet the faucet with a quick splash of water, then take a dry paper towel and wipe until dry and spotless.
